Description: Osaka, Japan-based Diamond Electric Mfg. Co. Ltd. agreed to plead guilty and to pay a $19 million criminal fine for its role in a conspiracy to fix prices of ignition coils installed in cars sold in the United States and elsewhere.

Info Source: Included in a dataset downloaded at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Company is plan administrator. Penalty amount reported in range of $10,001 to $50,000.

NAICS Translation: 336322: Other Motor Vehicle Electrical and Electronic Equipment Manufacturing
